Merge Sorted Array

Given two sorted integer arrays A and B, merge B into A as one sorted array.

Note: You may assume that A has enough space (size that is greater or equal to m + n) to hold additional elements from B. The number of elements initialized in A and B are m and nrespectively.

public class Solution {
    public void merge(int A[], int m, int B[], int n) {
        int curr = m + n - 1;    // note: cannot use A.length - 1
        int i = m - 1;
        int j = n - 1;
        while (i >= 0 && j >= 0) {
            if (A[i] > B[j]) {
                A[curr--] = A[i--];
            } else {
                A[curr--] = B[j--];
            }
        }

        while(i >= 0) {
            A[curr--] = A[i--];
        }

        while (j >= 0) {
            A[curr--] = B[j--];
        }

    }
}

Analysis: time complexity: o(m + n), space complexity o(1);
